/THIS-IS-IT-I-JUST-NEED-TO-MAKE-IT-WORK.title: Setting up Quartz
/THIS-IS-IT-I-JUST-NEED-TO-MAKE-IT-WORK.content:
related: [rabbit hole of searching for something and ending up tinkering on something else](../private/01-slipbox/rabbit%20hole%20of%20searching%20for%20something%20and%20ending%20up%20tinkering%20on%20something%20else.md)

also: i don't know a lot about linux

## Attempts

Can't seem to make this work: [Setup (jzhao.xyz)](https://quartz.jzhao.xyz/notes/setup/)
also: 

* need to keep private notes unpublished
* want to keep everything in one vault

Found this resource!:

* [Publish your Obsidian Vault Online for Free with Quartz - YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ITiiuBNVue0)
* [Publishing your Obsidian Vault Online with Quartz (brandonkboswell.com)](https://brandonkboswell.com/blog/Publishing-your-Obsidian-Vault-Online-with-Quartz/)

Steps I did:

* tried to install npm, go etc but hard to use with Windows 11. 
* Installed Linux on Windows instead using [WSL](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install)
* Cloned [Quartz](https://github.com/jackyzha0/quartz), [obsidian-export](https://github.com/brandonkboswell/obsidian-export), [hugo-obsidian](https://github.com/jackyzha0/hugo-obsidian), and my empty [digital-garden](https://github.com/janeilagan/digital-garden) repo, locally.
* ![](_attachments/f112e8405311f228eab54d4f87a50fb9.png) 
* ![](_attachments/30e2229dcfca767e579587a0a7c458a2.png)
* Used `-f` as the posted command fails.

````git
git submodule add -f https://github.com/janeilagan/digital-garden.git ./public

````

* Installed Hugo ![](_attachments/06112138507661c07f32468184c13113.png)

* for this one ![](_attachments/684b2a59a0610de2dfdbf05476061237.png) >> i used `sudo apt-get install cargo` then: `curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh` >> then run `cargo build` again

* can't get 'go' to work properly
  ![](_attachments/9185b4412f47ebc60683a218e34c0d8f.png)

````zsh
export GOPATH=$HOME/go  
export GOROOT="$(brew --prefix golang)/libexec"  
export PATH="$PATH:${GOPATH}/bin:${GOROOT}/bin"
source $HOME/.zshrc
````

* For nodemon `sudo apt-get install npm`
* changed zsh to bash

````bash
sudo chsh -s /bin/zsh $USER
````

* [workflow for publishing digital garden](workflow%20for%20publishing%20digital%20garden.md)

/anxious-about-digital-footprint-and-pri.title: anxious about digital footprint and privacy
/anxious-about-digital-footprint-and-pri.content:
## Syncing, backups and what

[OneDrive Security: How Safe Are Your Files in 2022 (cloudwards.net)](https://www.cloudwards.net/onedrive-security/)

1. how safe is OneDrive

1. should I encrypt all my files?

1. should I utilize personal vault? cons and pros?
   
   * cons
     * Sharing of files in Personal Vault is blocked, meaning you canâ€™t accidentally share a file from Personal Vault
     * Files in Personal Vault are not stored unprotected or cached on your PC, on your device, or in the browser
   * pros
     * Files in Personal Vault files are encrypted using BitLocker when in use locally on a Windows 10 PC (which I'm already doing locally)
1. any 3rd party encryption alternative?

1. does it still matter since the files are already there anyway?

1. should I continue using GitHub for version control of my vault

1. [encrypt git repo](../private/01-slipbox/encrypt%20git%20repo.md)

1. can I use OneDrive, then host it as git repo or something idk

1. file versioning

1. [backup vault locally](backup%20vault%20locally.md) backup solution? is this enough?

/how-do-I-ensure-my-devices-are-synced.title: how do I ensure my devices are synced
/how-do-I-ensure-my-devices-are-synced.content:
## What I'm looking for

* not costly (I really want to try Obsidian Sync but I'm not sure if it's worth it)
* can sync with iPhone and iPad
* can sync with other Windows devices
* sync plugins as well 
* make use of my OneDrive Personal storage/subscription
* encryption

### Options

#### [Syncthing](https://syncthing.net/)

* usage is only free up to 20MB

#### [Remotely-save](https://github.com/remotely-save/remotely-save)

* open source and free
* can be used with iPhone and iPad
  * caveat: will be using the phone/iPad's storage
  * plugins are not synced (not sure if this is possible since sync with _ is available, but since I'm using git too I didn't want to sync that as well)
* makes use of OneDrive Personal 
* encrypted, but I personally used another OneDrive account rather than granting the plugin access to my personal one.
* easy to configure.
* went with this!

/how-much-should-you-publish-online.title: how much should I publish online
/how-much-should-you-publish-online.content:
## [should I publish my notes online](../private/01-slipbox/should%20I%20publish%20my%20notes%20online.md)?

Permanent notes are directed towards audience ignorant of the thoughts behind the text
unsure of what the context is only have general knowledge on the field;

(or as my anxiety tells me, can be read by someone who already knows that same shit and would judge you because you're writing shit.)

So, instead, I decided I will be writing for myself. Because [the only way to learn in public is to build in public](the%20only%20way%20to%20learn%20in%20public%20is%20to%20build%20in%20public.md).

Whilst reorganizing my old notes, I found so many poems and novels and ideas that never really went out. Or if it did, I hid behind anonymous pennames (just because.)

I don't have Facebook, Instagram, Twitter or any personal account so putting this out made me [anxious about digital footprint and privacy](anxious%20about%20digital%20footprint%20and%20privacy.md). 

Fueled by self doubts, I was asking myself If I needed a penname, or if I should have all my notes (personal and professional) here, or if I really plan on staying anonymous for life.

I still don't know the answer to it.

Taking one step at a time :)

/how-to-publish-your-notes-online.title: How to publish your notes online
/how-to-publish-your-notes-online.content:
## What I want

* little to no cost (Obsidian Publish is great but costly ðŸ˜¥)
* with graph view
* easy to deploy
* using GitHub Pages

### [how much should you publish online](how%20much%20should%20you%20publish%20online.md)

* [The only way to learn in public is to build in public â€¢ Mental Nodes](https://www.mentalnodes.com/the-only-way-to-learn-in-public-is-to-build-in-public)
* For inspiration: [About â€¢ Mental Nodes](https://www.mentalnodes.com/about)
  * This is using this [kmcgillivray/obsidian-lettersmith: Transform any Obsidian vault (or any folder of markdown files) into a backlink-powered static website using Lettersmith. (github.com)](https://github.com/kmcgillivray/obsidian-lettersmith)

## Options

[Obsidian Publish alternatives - Share & showcase - Obsidian Forum](https://forum.obsidian.md/t/obsidian-publish-alternatives/22886)

### [obsidian-userland/publish](https://obsidian-userland.github.io/)

* looks simple and nice, but long way to go and too many limitations

### [Pubsidian](https://forum.obsidian.md/t/pubsidian-free-and-elegant-obsidian-publish-alternative/21825)

* needs to be installed (it's essentially a converter)
* great view, would consider using because of interface
* using Netlify (for some reason my ISP blocks Netlify here)
* Attempts:
  * not working yet (cant get it to show the actual pages!) 
  * Update: got it working but links are not working T_T
  * Pause. Trying something else.

### [Obsidian mkdocs](https://github.com/jobindjohn/obsidian-publish-mkdocs)

* should be easy to use and deploy as I have used mkdocs before 
* however no graph view

### [Perlite](https://github.com/secure-77/Perlite)

* too many dependencies
* too many tweaking required
* I need to read through further to know, long learning curve

### [Mindstone](https://github.com/TuanManhCao/digital-garden)

* UI looks great
* plain graph (in comparison to Pubsidian and obsidian-nola )
* can be tested locally
* known issues with graph view

### [Obsidian Zola](https://github.com/ppeetteerrs/obsidian-zola)

* really pretty interface based from Adidoks
* Using Netlify (still can't get it to work with my ISP)
* Cant get to work locally for testing
* was able to partially make it work, but links aren't working, and having hard time testing it because of ISP limitation (I had to use VPN)

### [Quartz](https://github.com/jackyzha0/quartz)

* pretty interface, sitting on top of Hugo
* can use GitHub pages
* can test locally
* has graph interface (and pretty one too!)
* [THIS IS IT I JUST NEED TO MAKE IT WORK!!](THIS%20IS%20IT%20I%20JUST%20NEED%20TO%20MAKE%20IT%20WORK!!.md)

/how-to-write-notes-properly.title: How to write notes properly
/how-to-write-notes-properly.content:
## Is there a correct way of writing notes?

Like everyone who wanted some sort of workflow in the way they take down notes, I became obsessed with PKMs and Obsidian.

Back in the older days, I would buy physical notebooks (even though I was never really a good note taker). I just loved the idea of having a place to write down anything and come back to it when I want to. 

I started tinkering with Notion, even halfway moving all my notes to it, but then I realized that I was spending my time customizing Notion, rather than actually taking notes and making use of them. 

And whilst I was knee-deep into researching about Notion templates and workflows, I stumbled upon the PKM world, and then Obsidian. 

At the time of this writing, I've only been using Obsidian for a couple of months. I had so many questions around PKMs and Obsidian in general, which spiraled into more questions about my personal workflow, and led me into an existential crisis. 

Questions like [best way to take notes](best%20way%20to%20take%20notes.md) became [should I publish my notes online](../private/01-slipbox/should%20I%20publish%20my%20notes%20online.md) then [how much should you publish online](how%20much%20should%20you%20publish%20online.md), spiraling into *oh wait I'm [anxious about digital footprint and privacy](anxious%20about%20digital%20footprint%20and%20privacy.md)* into *but what if I need to note down something on my phone, [how do I ensure my devices are synced](how%20do%20I%20ensure%20my%20devices%20are%20synced.md)* and then worrying about [how do I back up my notes](../private/01-slipbox/how%20do%20I%20back%20up%20my%20notes.md) and so on.

My head was in overdrive because there's all these possibilities and just *where the hell do I start?*

/my-digital-garden.title: my digital garden
/my-digital-garden.content:
## Hi, I'm Jane

I'm a tech enthusiast and a cat mom of four. Professionally, I work in IT, but I enjoy tech in general.

I tend to get lost in the rabbit hole of *attempting* to [build my second brain](../private/01-slipbox/build%20my%20second%20brain.md) using [Obsidian](https://obsidian.md/) and [Notion](https://www.notion.so/). The intent of this site is to become [my digital garden](https://janeilagan.github.io/digital-garden/) and not a formal blog. It's less focused on polishing what I put here, so if you see any dead links, those are probably ideas not cultivated yet, or they link to my private notes inside my vault. 

Majority of the time, the notes are written as if I'm talking to myself.

(Because I am.)

The goal is to put these thoughts out there, look back at it years later, and cringe. Hard.

$~$

 > 
 > Learn to live alongside cringe. No matter how hard you try to avoid being cringe, you will look back on your life and cringe retrospectively. Cringe is unavoidable over a lifetime. Even the term â€˜cringeâ€™ might someday be deemed â€˜cringeâ€™.
 > 
 > -Taylor Swift, NYU speech

$~$

### digital swiss army knife

[wox](https://github.com/Wox-launcher/) | [vscode](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode) | [share-x](https://github.com/ShareX) | [obsidian](https://obsidian.md/) | [notion](https://www.notion.so/) | [bitwarden](https://github.com/bitwarden) 

$~$

### credits

[stealing from my heroes](https://joschuasgarden.com/30+External/31+Books/Steal+Like+an+Artist+%E2%80%93+10+Things+Nobody+Told+You+About+Being+Creative) | this digital garden is made possible with [Obsidian](https://obsidian.md/), [Quartz](https://github.com/jackyzha0/quartz), this awesome [blog](https://brandonkboswell.com/blog/Publishing-your-Obsidian-Vault-Online-with-Quartz/), and [mental nodes](https://www.mentalnodes.com/) for inspiration.

$~$

### contact

I'm only available online here, on [GitHub](https://github.com/janeilagan) and [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/janeilagan/). 

(If you're looking to hire me, here's my [resume](https://janeilagan.github.io/resume/).)

/see-what-questions-to-ask.title: see what questions to ask
/see-what-questions-to-ask.content:
* what's missing?
* can i add something to it?
* combine something?
* [how does this fit to things i already know](how%20does%20this%20fit%20to%20things%20i%20already%20know)
* [can i use other words or terms to explain this properly](can%20i%20use%20other%20words%20or%20terms%20to%20explain%20this%20properly)
* [how can i use this to explain another idea](how%20can%20i%20use%20this%20to%20explain%20another%20idea)
* [when would i need this note again](when%20would%20i%20need%20this%20note%20again)
* will i publish this online? [how much should you publish online](how%20much%20should%20you%20publish%20online.md)

/the-only-way-to-learn-in-public-is-to-b.title: the only way to learn in public is to build in public
/the-only-way-to-learn-in-public-is-to-b.content:
> 
 > The only way to learn in public is to build in public
 > 
 > -Mental Nodes ([The only way to learn in public is to build in public â€¢ Mental Nodes](https://www.mentalnodes.com/the-only-way-to-learn-in-public-is-to-build-in-public))

This is to remind myself that I'm doing this for myself, for self-learning, and accept constructive feedback because those will push me into being a better version of myself. That it's okay to make mistakes, it's okay to change your mind, and it's okay to be embarrassed by what I originally put out, edit it again and make it better.
